questions.question_text:
Given the following Impact settings and Alerts in a three node cluster that makes up the components of a Business Service, what is the overall service health of this Business Service?
//IMG//

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: F
F is correct answer.
Treat the Impact = 70 as the threshold, with 3 node in cluster each have impact 33.3%, 2 in yellow (minor) means 66.6% which does not reach the threshold so it is still Clear (the proper terminology should be OK, not Clear)

comments.content: Actually, Clear is correct, since 2=~66.4 which is less than 70

discussion.content: Would love to see some input on this question. To me it seems Minor, since two of the three CIs have active alerts (if all 3 it would be Major). Clear definitely doesn't make sense.

questions.question_text: What does Operational Intelligence proactively identify before they cause service outages?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: E
E is correct answer.
https://docs.servicenow.com/bundle/washingtondc-it-operations-management/page/product/event-management/concept/operational-intelligence-overview.html

questions.question_text: What is the function of the External Communication Channel (ECC) Queue? (Choose three.)

choices.E: It contains records of CIs that the ServiceNow admin has submitted for entry into the CMDB.
choices.A: It is a connection point between a ServiceNow instance and the MID Server.
choices.C: It holds jobs that the MID Server needs to perform.
choices.D: It is a connection point between a hardware CI on a customer’s network and the MID Server.
choices.B: It contains probe records to be executed on the customer’s network.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: ABC
ABC is correct
Is the intent to fix these? The correct answer is ABC, it states ABE, which had me thinking I was wrong but the discussion kept me sane.

Selected Answer: ABC
A, B, C

Selected Answer: ABC
this is correct

Selected Answer: C
C is correct answer. Once can test this on below website 
https://regex101.com/

I just took the exam. In the exam, the question is actually: "the correct regex expression to capture the server's (webserver3) in ... []. 
C is not actually an alternative, but A, C and D are.

test in : https://regex101.com/
Answer is C .*\s(\w+\.\w+\.\w+).*

questions.question_text: The correct regex to capture the name of the server in “the server webserver3.domain.com is down” would be:

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
A is the correct answer
